story:
Once upon a time in the lush countryside of England, there was a curious little hedgehog named Hazel. Hazel lived in a cozy burrow at the edge of a beautiful forest, surrounded by tall oak trees and blooming wildflowers.

Every night, as the sun began to set and the stars started to twinkle in the sky, Hazel would venture out of her burrow to explore the enchanting forest. She would hop over mossy logs, sniff the fragrant wildflowers, and listen to the soothing sounds of the rustling leaves.

One evening, as Hazel was wandering through the forest, she heard a faint whimpering coming from a nearby bush. Curious and concerned, she followed the sound and to her surprise, she found a lost baby deer shivering in the cold.

Feeling a tug at her heart, Hazel gently nudged the baby deer with her nose and led her back to her burrow. There, she covered the deer with soft leaves and kept her warm throughout the night with her own spiky fur.

The next morning, the baby deer woke up feeling safe and protected, thanks to Hazel's kindness and generosity. Grateful for Hazel's care, the baby deer promised to visit her every night to play and explore the forest together.

From that day on, Hazel and the baby deer became the best of friends, embarking on countless adventures under the twinkling night sky. And as they frolicked through the forest, their laughter echoed through the trees, spreading warmth and joy to all the creatures in the countryside.

And so, as the stars shimmered overhead and the moon cast its gentle glow, Hazel and her newfound friend drifted off to sleep, knowing that they would always have each other to share in the magic of the forest.

The end. Goodnight, sleep tight, and sweet dreams, my dear child.
